title: Zimperium Mobile Threat Defense
descriptionMarkdown: Zimperium Mobile Threat Defense connector gives you the ability to connect the Zimperium threat log with Azure Sentinel to view dashboards, create custom alerts, and improve investigation. This gives you more insight into your organization's mobile threat landscape and enhances your security operation capabilities.

sampleQueries.description: All threats with threat vector equal to Device
All threats for devices running iOS
sampleQueries.query:
ZimperiumThreatLog_CL 
 | where device_os_s == "ios" 
 | order by event_timestamp_s  desc nulls last

ZimperiumMitigationLog_CL 
 | order by event_timestamp_s  desc nulls last

dataTypes.name: ZimperiumThreatLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ZimperiumThreatLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

dataTypes.name: ZimperiumMitigationLog_CL
dataTypes.lastDataReceivedQuery:
ZimperiumMitigationLog_CL
            | summarize Time = max(TimeGenerated)
            | where isnotempty(Time)

value:
ZimperiumThreatLog_CL
            | summarize LastLogReceived = max(TimeGenerated)
            | project IsConnected = LastLogReceived > ago(30d)

instructionSteps.title: Configure and connect Zimperium MTD
instructionSteps.description:
1. In zConsole, click **Manage** on the navigation bar.
2. Click the **Integrations** tab.
3. Click the **Threat Reporting** button and then the **Add Integrations** button.
4. Create the Integration:
  - From the available integrations, select Microsoft Azure Sentinel.
  - Enter your workspace id and primary key from the fields below, click **Next**.
  - Fill in a name for your Azure Sentinel integration.
  - Select a Filter Level for the threat data you wish to push to Azure Sentinel.
  - Click **Finish**
5. For additional instructions, please refer to the [Zimperium customer support portal](https://support.zimperium.com).
